intro: Faradaya albertisii, commonly known as the Albertis' faradaya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, often with a waxy coating. Faradaya albertisii is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
